subject: Junit executing tests in separate "clean" processes
msgSnippet: I wanted to write a couple of automated tests which operate on ObjectStore/Java... Ideally, the first execution would create data, and the subsequent test
messageBody:
I wanted to write a couple of automated tests which operate on
ObjectStore/Java... Ideally, the first execution would create data,
and the subsequent test would run in a fresh process, loading and
verifying the data.


I don't even know how to get junit to start a new test in a new
process. And I'm having another problem which might be related:

Clicking "run" on the Junit window a second time after a successful
first run always fails. ObjectStore applications load a native
library on start-up. Subsequent times I try to run the same test, I
get the following error:

java.lang.unsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library
c:\odi\osji\bin\o5osji_jdk.dll already loaded in another classloader.

Anyone know how I can get around this?
